ui_ux_improvements.title: Add focus states for keyboard navigation
ui_ux_improvements.description: Add visible focus indicators to all interactive elements (buttons, inputs, selects, tabs) for better keyboard navigation support
ui_ux_improvements.rationale: The current CSS has no :focus styles defined at all, making keyboard navigation nearly impossible for users who rely on it. This is a critical accessibility issue that affects users with motor disabilities or those who prefer keyboard navigation.
ui_ux_improvements.current_state: No focus indicators are visible when tabbing through interactive elements. Users cannot tell which element is currently focused when using keyboard navigation.
ui_ux_improvements.user_benefit: Users who navigate with keyboard can clearly see which element is focused, making the interface fully accessible for keyboard-only navigation

ui_ux_improvements.title: Standardize UI language to English
ui_ux_improvements.description: Replace all German UI text with English equivalents for consistent international user experience
ui_ux_improvements.rationale: The interface mixes German and English text inconsistently (e.g., 'Analysiere alle E-Mails' vs 'Save General Settings', 'Fortschritt' vs 'Progress'). This creates confusion and reduces usability for international users.
ui_ux_improvements.current_state:
Mixed language UI:
- Button: 'Analysiere alle E-Mails' (German)
- Button: 'Save General Settings' (English)
- Label: 'Fortschritt:' (German)
- Status: 'Starte Batch-Analyse...' (German)
- Help text: 'LLM-Antworten werden fÃ¼r 24 Stunden zwischengespeichert' (German)
ui_ux_improvements.proposed_change:
Standardize all UI text to English:
1. In options.html:
   - 'Analysiere alle E-Mails' -> 'Analyze All Emails'
   - 'Abbrechen' -> 'Cancel'
   - 'Queue leeren' -> 'Clear Queue'
   - 'Cache leeren' -> 'Clear Cache'
   - 'Fortschritt:' -> 'Progress:'
   - German help text -> English equivalents
2. In BatchAnalysisUI.ts:
   - Update all German status messages to English
3. In OptionsScript.ts:
   - Update German cache messages to English
ui_ux_improvements.user_benefit: Consistent English interface makes the extension accessible to international users and provides a more professional appearance

ui_ux_improvements.title: Fix mismatched form element IDs
ui_ux_improvements.description: Align HTML element IDs with the DOM selectors used in SettingsForm.ts to ensure form elements are found correctly
ui_ux_improvements.rationale: The HTML uses camelCase IDs (e.g., 'zaiPaasApiKey') while SettingsForm.ts tries to find kebab-case IDs (e.g., 'zai-paas-api-key'). This mismatch causes provider settings elements to not be found, breaking the save/load functionality for Zai providers.
ui_ux_improvements.current_state:
HTML has:
- id='zaiPaasApiKey'
- id='zaiPaasModel'
- id='zaiPaasBaseUrl'
- id='zaiCodingApiKey'
- id='zaiCodingModel'
- id='zaiCodingBaseUrl'

SettingsForm.ts looks for:
- 'zai-paas-api-key'
- 'zai-paas-model'
- 'zai-paas-base-url'
- 'zai-coding-api-key'
- 'zai-coding-model'
- 'zai-coding-base-url'
ui_ux_improvements.proposed_change:
Update options.html to use consistent kebab-case IDs matching SettingsForm.ts expectations:

<!-- Zai PaaS Settings -->
<input type='password' id='zai-paas-api-key' name='zai-paas-api-key'>
<select id='zai-paas-model' name='zai-paas-model'></select>
<input type='text' id='zai-paas-base-url' name='zai-paas-base-url'>

<!-- Zai Coding Settings -->
<input type='password' id='zai-coding-api-key' name='zai-coding-api-key'>
<select id='zai-coding-model' name='zai-coding-model'></select>
<input type='text' id='zai-coding-base-url' name='zai-coding-base-url'>
ui_ux_improvements.user_benefit: Zai provider configuration will work correctly - users can save and load their API keys and settings without errors

ui_ux_improvements.title: Add loading state to Save Settings button
ui_ux_improvements.description: Show visual loading feedback on the Save button during settings persistence to indicate the operation is in progress
ui_ux_improvements.rationale: When users click 'Save General Settings', there's no immediate visual feedback that the operation is processing. Users may click multiple times or think the extension is unresponsive. Adding a loading state improves perceived responsiveness.
ui_ux_improvements.current_state: The Save button has no visual change during the save operation. Only after completion does a status message appear briefly. Users have no indication that saving is in progress.
ui_ux_improvements.user_benefit: Users get immediate visual feedback that their settings are being saved, reducing uncertainty and preventing multiple clicks

ui_ux_improvements.title: Add visual required field indicators
ui_ux_improvements.description: Add asterisks and styling to indicate which form fields are required before submission
ui_ux_improvements.rationale: Required fields (API keys, model names) are not visually distinguished from optional fields. Users only discover requirements through validation errors after attempting to save, creating a frustrating trial-and-error experience.
ui_ux_improvements.current_state: All form labels look identical. Users cannot tell which fields are mandatory (API keys) vs optional (base URLs). The 'required' attribute exists on some inputs but has no visual indicator.
ui_ux_improvements.user_benefit: Users can immediately identify which fields must be filled out, reducing form submission errors and improving task completion efficiency
